title: Sensex hits 75,000, it was at 25,000 when PM Modi won 10 years ago
selftext:
**Good morning, everyone!**

**Sensex Hits Historic Milestone**

Exciting news from the financial realm today as the Sensex, India's key stock market index, surges to an unprecedented milestone of 75,000 points. Let's delve into the details:

**1. Landmark Achievement:**

The Sensex reaching the 75,000 mark marks a momentous occasion in India's economic history, symbolizing the country's remarkable resilience and growth trajectory.

**2. Investor Confidence:**

The journey of Sensex from 25,000 to 75,000 points over the past decade underscores the unwavering confidence of investors in the Indian market and highlights its stability.

**3. Impact of Government Policies:**

The policies implemented under Prime Minister Modi's leadership likely played a pivotal role in driving this growth, instilling optimism among investors, and fostering an environment conducive to economic expansion.

**4. Sustained Progress:**

The gradual yet steady increase in Sensex over the span of a decade reflects the nation's sustained economic progress, indicating long-term stability and growth prospects.

**5. Wealth Creation:**

The surge in Sensex translates to enhanced wealth for investors, signifying the robust performance of the market and the tangible benefits reaped by stakeholders.

Read more at:

[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/109176567.cms?utm\_source=contentofinterest&utm\_medium=text&utm\_campaign=cppst](http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/109176567.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst)
comments: I dont know how stock market is doing so well?
I’m going to give standard reply that this government gives when numbers like press freedom index etc are put out - “we don’t accept these numbers”

I mean what’s surprising about it? A healthy growing economy with Pro capitalistic policies with heavy investment in infrastructure making the viability of businesses increase will make obviously lead to the stock market doing good.

The Indian stock market historically grew at 15% p.a., which means it tripples every 7.5 years and in 10 years it becomes 4 times.

**The Modi government underperformed by 25% despite extremely high PE multiples.**
Indexes grow over time. Surprise surprise.
Yeah, it was around 5500 in 2004. It grew under MMS as well (and more in percentage terms).
18% CAGR from 2004 to 2014 and 11.6% from 2014 to 2024. Well done!!
by the way bhakts have been touching their privates over this news it feels like before 2014 the growth was 0 and suddenly they poured some tea on the sensex floor and the graphs went up
And with all this effort, the CAGR is only 11.6%, should it not have been more than the 16 % seen in the MMS & PC era?
Ben ke love day /s - he who must not be named.
